sources.title: Sitting Bull (1954)
sources.description: Chief Sitting Bull of the Sioux tribe is forced by the Indian-hating General Custer to react with violence, resulting in the famous Last Stand at Little Bighorn. Parrish, a friend to the Sioux, tries to prevent the bloodshed, but is court- martialed for "collaborating" with the enemy. Sitting Bull, however, manages to intercede with President Grant on Parrish's behalf. Written by Jim Beaver Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/sitting-bull-1954/

sources.title: Sitting Bull
sources.description: A cavalry officer sympathetic to the wronged Sioux fixes a meeting between Chief Sitting Bull and President Grant but a dishonest Indian Agent and a hateful General Custer test the Sioux's patience, threatening to derail the peace-talks.

sources.title: Sitting Bull (1954) One Great Chief. One Last Stand - Western Movie
sources.description:
Legendary Lakota chief Sitting Bull leads his people, outsmarting General Custer in a legendary clash at Little Bighorn.  He confronts powerful U.S. opposition for years before his final surrender.

Original title: Sitting Bull (1954)

Director: Sidney Salkow
Writers: Jack DeWitt, Sidney Salkow

Main cast:
Dale Robertson - Major Robert Parrish
Mary Murphy - Kathy Howell
J. Carrol Naish - Sitting Bull
John Litel - General Custer
Joel Fluellen - Sam
Robert Warwick - President Ulysses S. Grant
Iron Eyes Cody - Crazy Horse
John Hamilton - General Howell

Genres: Drama, Western, Biography, History, War
Release date: August 17, 1954 (USA)

metadata.Plot: Chief Sitting Bull of the Sioux tribe is forced by the Indian-hating General Custer to react with violence, resulting in the famous Last Stand at Little Bighorn. Parrish, a friend to the Sioux, tries to prevent the bloodshed, but is court- martialed for "collaborating" with the enemy. Sitting Bull, however, manages to intercede with President Grant on Parrish's behalf.
metadata.Actors: Dale Robertson, Mary Murphy, J. Carrol Naish
